intro: Phoebe hainesiana, commonly known as Haines' phoebe, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as cinnamon and avocado. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
